inclusion.criterion: Adult patients emergency admitted for suspected acute appendicitis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Computed Tomography of the abdomen with contrast confirmed uncomplicated appendicitis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: as evidenced by presence of a dilated, thickened wall appendix without perforation
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Evidence of perforation, abscess or gangrene of appendix on CT scan
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Significant paralytic ileus as evidenced by dilated bowel loops on imaging
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Evidence of co-existing acute surgical pathologies on the CT scan
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Allergic to bowel preparation solution (Polyethylene glycol)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 17-year-old boy with severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. He has been diagnosed with acute perforated appendicitis and is now a candidate for emergent laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.
